messages.title: Â£18 million for Trinity High School
messages.content: Artists' impression of the new school on the existing site. The council has committed to fund the rebuild of the school for 1,200 pupils.

messages.title: Weekly Surgery Advice
messages.content: Councillors here to help you: surgery times for local residents.

messages.title: THANK YOU
messages.content: A big thank you to everyone who supported LABOUR (Hulme) in the elections.

messages.title: Improved Recycling Facilities For Hulme
messages.content: Recycling banks for bottles, cans, paper and plastic pots, tubs and trays have now been provided at Birley Fields Hulme.

messages.title: Arch Bar
messages.content: Bar on Jackson Crescent benefits from new management fostering a 'good community atmosphere' and refurbishment.

messages.title: Artists appointed for Birley Fields development
messages.content: Commission includes a new piece of public art and poetry engraved in granite steps, along with other features.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Committed to fund the rebuild of Trinity High School for 1,200 pupils.
Weekly surgery times for local residents to receive advice and support from councillors.
Provision of improved recycling facilities at Birley Fields Hulme for bottles, cans, paper, and plastics.
Supporting new management at Arch Bar and fostering a good community atmosphere.
Artists commissioned for new public art as part of the Birley Fields development project.

issues.education: Committed to fund the rebuild of Trinity High School for 1,200 pupils.
issues.environment: Provision of improved recycling facilities at Birley Fields Hulme for bottles, cans, paper, and plastics.

images.caption: Rendering of Birley Fields development art project
